page.title: 01Rural Downland South Buriton
page.content: This area has remained rural, though there have been changes in farming, housing and industry. There are 21 widely scattered dwellings, only two of which have been built since 1950. These originally housed farm and forestry workers or employees of Ditcham Estate. A few still do, but most are owned by people who work elsewhere. There is no public transport, so all drive to work. There are 2 small works, Buriton Saw Mills & Circuit Engineering. Both are sited in disused quarries, relics of the large lime works. A HCC tip utilises another quarry and it was feared that this would spread to a pit nearer Buriton. Crossing the area on the ridge is the South Downs Way which follows an ancient trackway. The Queen Elizabeth Park caters for countryside pursuits receiving \ million visitors a year.
